Intermediate (CBSE)-Score: 88.6% Aug. 2018 – May 2019
Projects
AI Document SummarizerFastAPI, NLP, Transformers
• Built an AI-powered document summarization platform supporting PDF, DOCX, and TXT files.
• Designed REST APIs using FastAPI and implemented transformer models (T5, BART).
• Improved summarization quality using hierarchical and extractive NLP techniques.
Real-Time MERN Chat ApplicationMongoDB, Express, React, Node.js
• Developed a real-time chat application using Socket.IO for live communication.
• Designed MongoDB schemas and implemented encrypted user data storage.
LSTM-Based Portfolio OptimizationPython, LSTM, Machine Learning
• Built an ML-driven portfolio optimization system using LSTM-based volatility forecasting.
• Integrated predictions with Modern Portfolio Theory for dynamic asset allocation.
• Achieved an 18% improvement in Sharpe Ratio over traditional MPT models.
Heart Sound Classification Using CNNsDeep Learning, CNN, Signal Processing
• Developed a CNN-based model to classify normal vs abnormal heart sounds.
• Extracted MFCC and spectrogram features from the PhysioNet PCG dataset.
• Achieved high accuracy in detecting pathological heart conditions.
Internship Experience
Software Engineering InternEPAM Systems
India 6 Months
• Worked on backend development using Spring and Spring Boot.
• Built MVC-based applications using Thymeleaf.
• Followed enterprise-level coding standards and collaborative workflows.
Technical Skills
Languages: Java, Python, C/C++, SQL
Backend & Web: FastAPI, React, Node.js, REST APIs
Databases: MongoDB, MySQL
Machine Learning: Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Keras, NLP, LSTM, CNN
Data Engineering: Data Pipelines, ETL, Apache Airflow
Tools: Git, Postman, MongoDB Compass, Jupyter Notebook, Linux
jd_text:
Dine3D – Job Description (Software Developer)
Company Overview
Dine3D is a technology-driven company specializing in interactive digital solutions, including 3D
menus, smart restaurant systems, and modern web applications for the hospitality industry.
Role Overview
We are looking for a skilled Software Developer to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will
work on building scalable web applications, interactive user experiences, and backend services that
power Dine3D’s products.
Key Responsibilities
 Develop and maintain web applications and dashboards
 Build scalable backend APIs and services
 Work with modern frontend frameworks and UI components
 Integrate third-party services and payment gateways
 Collaborate with designers and product teams
 Debug, optimize, and improve application performance
Required Skills
 Strong knowledge of JavaScript / TypeScript
 Experience with React or similar frontend frameworks
 Experience with Node.js / NestJS backend development
 Knowledge of REST APIs and databases
 Familiarity with Git and deployment workflows
Preferred Skills
 Experience with cloud platforms and VPS deployments
 Understanding of 3D, WebGL, or interactive UI concepts
 Experience with Electron or mobile development is a plus
What We Offer
 Opportunity to work on innovative 3D-based products
 Flexible work environment
 Growth-focused and collaborative team culture
 Competitive compensation based on skills and experience
Location
Hybrid / Remote (India)
Company
Dine3D

history.content: Hi Akash, I'm Alex, a Senior Software Engineer here at Dine3D. Thanks for joining us today. I've had a look through your resume, and it's quite impressive. Your Real-Time MERN Chat Application project really stood out, as it aligns well with the stack we use. Could you start by walking me through the architecture of that application and the role Socket.IO played in enabling real-time communication?

So, hi Alex, I am a Monstack developer, as you know that. So in the chat application, I used web sockets with Mongo DB. I I made the gateways using Nest JS and I implemented them using authorization token. I also I was also passing authorization token to create the gateway and all that. That's all. So like sir, it will automatically detect the silence after 3 seconds. Sorry.

Thanks for sharing that overview. You've mentioned building APIs in a few of your projects. Could you explain what, in your view, makes an API truly "RESTful" and what key principles you adhere to when designing one?

JOB DESCRIPTION:
Dine3D – Job Description (Software Developer)
Company Overview
Dine3D is a technology-driven company specializing in interactive digital solutions, including 3D
menus, smart restaurant systems, and modern web applications for the hospitality industry.
Role Overview
We are looking for a skilled Software Developer to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will
work on building scalable web applications, interactive user experiences, and backend services that
power Dine3D’s products.
Key Responsibilities
 Develop and maintain web applications and dashboards
 Build scalable backend APIs and services
 Work with modern frontend frameworks and UI components
 Integrate third-party services and payment gateways
 Collaborate with designers and product teams
 Debug, optimize, and improve application performance
Required Skills
 Strong knowledge of JavaScript / TypeScript
 Experience with React or similar frontend frameworks
 Experience with Node.js / NestJS backend development
 Knowledge of REST APIs and databases
 Familiarity with Git and deployment workflows
Preferred Skills
 Experience with cloud platforms and VPS deployments
 Understanding of 3D, WebGL, or interactive UI concepts
 Experience with Electron or mobile development is a plus
What We Offer
 Opportunity to work on innovative 3D-based products
 Flexible work environment
 Growth-focused and collaborative team culture
 Competitive compensation based on skills and experience
Location
Hybrid / Remote (India)
Company
Dine3D

YOUR INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Act purely as the interviewer. Do NOT output any meta-text like "Here is the interview" or "***".
2. Speak in a natural, conversational, yet professional tone. Avoid robotic phrasing.
3. Start IMMEDIATELY with a warm, brief introduction and your first question.
4. Your goal is to assess if the candidate fits the JD based on their Resume.
5. Ask ONE clear question at a time.
6. If the candidate mentions a project, ask technical details about it that relate to the JD.

Start the interview now. Introduction + First Question only.
